intro: Navarretia ciliata, commonly known as the fringed larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Navarretia ciliata is an annual herb that produces small, hairy leaves with a distinctive fringe along the edges. It is known for its rapid life cycle, blooming early in the spring and completing its life cycle before summer heat sets in.
